page.title: 05Class 3 Homes
page.content: In our class there are 29 children. Ten live in bungalows,9 in houses, 3 in flats and 7 in caravans.Fourteen children have central heating,17 have coal fires and 11 gas fires. Houses, bungalows and flats are made of 2 walls of bricks with cavity insulation between them.Double glazing and loft insulation also keep them warm.Windows are made from wood or metal with panes of glass.Most homes have 3 bedrooms. The kitchen is used to cook and prepare meals.It usually has a gas or an electric cooker,a fridge to keep food cool and sometimes a freezer to store frozen food.Other gadgets are micro-wave ovens,washing machines, electric kettles and toasters.The bath room usually contains a bath,W.C. and wash basin.The lounge is where adults relax or children play with their toys.
